EXTRACTED VALUE: For all its promise, this is another entirely superfluous superhero game. [June 2008, p.70]
Ease of play combines with the game’s slow pace to undermine all Taito’s good intentions. [Aug 2006, p.128]
Its slow and boring pace kills what should be some of the best tennis around given the game's lineup of stars.
It is not something that we can recommend experiencing, as even for fans this instalment does little to push ahead or celebrate both games.
The game looks good, but is let down by a poor camera control system and the music is simply woeful.
Dynasty Warriors is as stagnated as ever and now carries the weight of a niche franchise upon its back. An overhaul is long overdue.
A dull, repetitive slog against unresponsive A.I. across hideously detailed environments. [Issue #16, p.62]
Admittedly, the game is gorgeous. But because the narrative is as linear and rigid as a steel pipe, it's a shallow sort of beauty. [Sept 2007, p.83]
A pile of uninspired, by-the-numbers gameplay and missed opportunities.
